The given Node.js code defines a function `hoistNonReactStatics` that is responsible for copying non-React specific static properties from one component to another. This is commonly used in Higher-Order Components (HOC) development, where it is necessary to ensure that static methods defined on a wrapped component are available on the resulting enhanced component. The code handles various types of React components (such as `ForwardRef` and `Memo`) and includes logic to avoid copying certain properties known to cause issues, such as function arity and `prototype`.

Here's the rewritten code:

```javascript
'use strict';

const reactIs = require('react-is');

// Object holding React specific static properties
const REACT_STATICS = {
  childContextTypes: true,
  contextType: true,
  contextTypes: true,
  defaultProps: true,
  displayName: true,
  getDefaultProps: true,
  getDerivedStateFromError: true,
  getDerivedStateFromProps: true,
  mixins: true,
  propTypes: true,
  type: true
};

// Object holding known static properties of functions
const KNOWN_STATICS = {
  name: true,
  length: true,
  prototype: true,
  caller: true,
  callee: true,
  arguments: true,
  arity: true
};

// React-specific statics for ForwardRef components
const FORWARD_REF_STATICS = {
  '$$typeof': true,
  render: true,
  defaultProps: true,
  displayName: true,
  propTypes: true
};

// React-specific statics for Memo components
const MEMO_STATICS = {
  '$$typeof': true,
  compare: true,
  defaultProps: true,
  displayName: true,
  propTypes: true,
  type: true
};

// Mapping of React types to their specific statics
const TYPE_STATICS = {
  [reactIs.ForwardRef]: FORWARD_REF_STATICS,
  [reactIs.Memo]: MEMO_STATICS
};

// Function to get the appropriate statics for a given component
function getStatics(component) {
  if (reactIs.isMemo(component)) {
    return MEMO_STATICS;
  }
  return TYPE_STATICS[component['$$typeof']] || REACT_STATICS;
}

// Object manipulation methods
const defineProperty = Object.defineProperty;
const getOwnPropertyNames = Object.getOwnPropertyNames;
const getOwnPropertySymbols = Object.getOwnPropertySymbols;
const getOwnPropertyDescriptor = Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor;
const getPrototypeOf = Object.getPrototypeOf;
const objectPrototype = Object.prototype;

// Main function to hoist statics
function hoistNonReactStatics(targetComponent, sourceComponent, blacklist) {
  if (typeof sourceComponent !== 'string') { // Skip string (HTML element) components
    if (objectPrototype) {
      const inheritedComponent = getPrototypeOf(sourceComponent);
      if (inheritedComponent && inheritedComponent !== objectPrototype) {
        hoistNonReactStatics(targetComponent, inheritedComponent, blacklist);
      }
    }

    let keys = getOwnPropertyNames(sourceComponent);
    if (getOwnPropertySymbols) {
      keys = keys.concat(getOwnPropertySymbols(sourceComponent));
    }

    const targetStatics = getStatics(targetComponent);
    const sourceStatics = getStatics(sourceComponent);

    for (let i = 0; i < keys.length; ++i) {
      const key = keys[i];
      if (!(KNOWN_STATICS[key] || (blacklist && blacklist[key]) || (sourceStatics && sourceStatics[key]) || (targetStatics && targetStatics[key]))) {
        const descriptor = getOwnPropertyDescriptor(sourceComponent, key);
        try {
          defineProperty(targetComponent, key, descriptor);
        } catch (e) {
          // Ignore errors on read-only properties
        }
      }
    }
  }
  return targetComponent;
}

module.exports = hoistNonReactStatics;
```
